intro: Dianthus xylorrhizus, commonly known as the rock campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Dianthus xylorrhizus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
